values.title: 3 to 4 2020-03-10
values.reason: Closing as this is already being done in the below linked PR

values.description:
Added APIs for

* setting a visual’s visibility flags
* setting a camera’s visibility mask

Visibility masks are currently supported for normal RGB cameras. Other sensors like depth, thermal, gpu rays rely shaders to generate data, which require more effort to make the visibility mask/flags work.

‌
values.title: Add support for setting visibility mask and flags

summary.raw:
Added APIs for

* setting a visual’s visibility flags
* setting a camera’s visibility mask

Visibility masks are currently supported for normal RGB cameras. Other sensors like depth, thermal, gpu rays rely shaders to generate data, which require more effort to make the visibility mask/flags work.

‌
summary.html:
Added APIs for

  • setting a visual’s visibility flags
  • setting a camera’s visibility mask

Visibility masks are currently supported for normal RGB cameras. Other sensors like depth, thermal, gpu rays rely shaders to generate data, which require more effort to make the visibility mask/flags work.

‌

values.description:
This PR removes the optimization in the function to convert Ogre V1 to V2 meshes that converts mesh vertices to half precision floats.

The Ogre documentation recommends [enabling the optimization](https://ogrecave.github.io/ogre/api/2.1/class_ogre_1_1_mesh.html#a0a5f88956c17ef23f649c1875d9980e9) for most applications, however it causes noticeable artifacts for large meshes that require a high precision.  
Example artifact in our setup \(a wall of a very large building mesh\):

Ogre1 \(and Ogre2 after the PR\), with full precision:

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/zq9ear/images/2571847429-image.png)
Ogre2 before the PR with half precision:

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/zq9ear/images/268790975-image.png)
‌
values.title: Removed half precision vertices OGRE2 optimization.

The Ogre documentation recommends [enabling the optimization](https://ogrecave.github.io/ogre/api/2.1/class_ogre_1_1_mesh.html#a0a5f88956c17ef23f649c1875d9980e9) for most applications, however it causes noticeable artifacts for large meshes that require a high precision.  
Example artifact in our setup \(a wall of a very large building mesh\):

Ogre1 \(and Ogre2 after the PR\), with full precision:

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/zq9ear/images/2571847429-image.png)
Ogre2 before the PR with half precision:

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/zq9ear/images/268790975-image.png)
‌

The Ogre documentation recommends enabling the optimization for most applications, however it causes noticeable artifacts for large meshes that require a high precision.
Example artifact in our setup (a wall of a very large building mesh):

values.description:
Added APIs to set skeleton node \(bone\) weights. The node weight determines how much influence a node has on the animation being played. 

Updated the `actor_animation` demo with a key binding \(`R`\) to toggle the skeleton root node’s weight between 0 and 1. When the weight is 0, you can see that the actor’s hip \(root node\) is no longer updated when the animation is playing. 

Note that currently setting weight only affects skeleton animation that is not being manually updated through local skeleton transforms.
values.title: Support setting skeleton node weights

summary.raw:
Added APIs to set skeleton node \(bone\) weights. The node weight determines how much influence a node has on the animation being played. 

Updated the `actor_animation` demo with a key binding \(`R`\) to toggle the skeleton root node’s weight between 0 and 1. When the weight is 0, you can see that the actor’s hip \(root node\) is no longer updated when the animation is playing. 

Note that currently setting weight only affects skeleton animation that is not being manually updated through local skeleton transforms.
summary.html:
Added APIs to set skeleton node (bone) weights. The node weight determines how much influence a node has on the animation being played.

Updated the actor_animation demo with a key binding (R) to toggle the skeleton root node’s weight between 0 and 1. When the weight is 0, you can see that the actor’s hip (root node) is no longer updated when the animation is playing.

Note that currently setting weight only affects skeleton animation that is not being manually updated through local skeleton transforms.

values.description: merges the `Transform` and `MinMax` functions into one
values.title: Add  transformAxisAlignedBox function

summary.raw: merges the `Transform` and `MinMax` functions into one

values.description:
Needed for [Ignition Gazebo PR 558](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/558), clear remaining resources on destruction of Ogre2GpuRay object.

Specifically, on a second call to Destroy\(\) Ogre2 threw an exception when removing a workspace that had already been removed, the rest of the changes are for consistency.

The upstream PR depends on default but figured would port this to rendering3 since it is a API / ABI compatible fix.
values.title: Ogre2 gpuray destroy cleanup

summary.raw:
Needed for [Ignition Gazebo PR 558](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/558), clear remaining resources on destruction of Ogre2GpuRay object.

Specifically, on a second call to Destroy\(\) Ogre2 threw an exception when removing a workspace that had already been removed, the rest of the changes are for consistency.

The upstream PR depends on default but figured would port this to rendering3 since it is a API / ABI compatible fix.
summary.html:
Needed for Ignition Gazebo PR 558, clear remaining resources on destruction of Ogre2GpuRay object.

Specifically, on a second call to Destroy() Ogre2 threw an exception when removing a workspace that had already been removed, the rest of the changes are for consistency.

The upstream PR depends on default but figured would port this to rendering3 since it is a API / ABI compatible fix.

values.description: the warning gets printed whenever there is an actor uses the same mesh in  `<skin>` and `<animation>` , which is the common use case. The warnings can be confusing to the user hence they are removed.
values.title: Remove duplicate animation warning

values.description:
Windows build failed due to undefined symbols. Added empty implementation to Wirebox class in the same way we did for other classes, e.g. see pull request #206

Here’s the old [build](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_rendering-pr-win/660/) that failed. 

New [build](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_rendering-pr-win/661/) looks good

‌
values.title: Fix windows build
